content:
We broke 1500 sites for the first time this week!
https://backdropcms.org/project/usage/backdrop

Total reported sites during last reporting period (Nov 21st) was 1,526.
...Drupal stats also jumped by ~100k sites as well in the last couple of weeks :sweat_smile: (from ~1mil to more than ~1.1mil)
https://www.drupal.org/project/usage/drupal

One thing B and D have in common: there were security updates recently. Maybe that has some influence on both stats. Potentially the sites that have the update manager disabled only show up in the stats when a security update is done (just a theory).
Your theory makes sense @indigoxela

Hi all, has anyone had any luck with using Feeds with image fields? I tried URI mapping (public://filename.jpg) but nothing gets picked up even though other fields import fine. And it looks like the additional options provided by File Field Sources for the image field aren't exposed to Feeds? Thanks for any tips!

@Quinn Dombrowski I have done it successfully. I worked out that Feeds needs an image URL that it can access to download the image. Therefore, your image URL needs to be such that you can enter it into a private browser tab and the image appears (I.e. http... and accessible by anonymous users).

@BWPanda Thanks! I gave that a try, and it's still not working. :grimacing: Here's one of the spreadsheet rows:
"46","","Hogarth Press Logo designed By E. McKnight Kauffer ","","Bruce Peel Special Collections, University of Alberta","","16"
and the configuration on Feeds: Screen-Shot-2020-12-04-at-3.30.31-PM.png
but nothing's getting picked up. Is there a step I missed?
Your spreadsheet row doesn't appear to have an image URL in it...?

Oops -- weird copy and paste error there.... "46","http://backdropv2.modernistarchives.com/files/logo.jpg","Hogarth Press Logo designed By E. McKnight Kauffer ","","Bruce Peel Special Collections, University of Alberta","","16"
Seems OK. I can access the image fine. Just double check your spreadsheet column names in the Feeds mapping. Or check Backdropcs logs to see if there are any errors listed...?

There's a few "Download of failed with code -1002." in the feeds log. And a ton of "Notice: Undefined index: module in feeds_system_info_alter() (line 750 of /home/modernis/backdropv2.modernistarchives.com/modules/feeds/feeds.module)" but that's been there ever since I enabled feeds. Any idea if either of those might be related?

@Quinn Dombrowski those notices seem to be a known issue: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/feeds/issues/13

PHP notice Undefined index: module in feeds_system_info_alter() 路 Issue #13 路 backdrop-contrib/feeds
I'm seeing my dblog flodded with the following PHP notices: Notice: Undefined index: module in feeds_system_info_alter() (line 819 of backdrop/modules/contrib/feeds/feeds.module). The following...
@klonos Yeah, I haven't been worrying about them because things were generally working okay with feeds, until this issue with not being able to import images. :exhausted:
Any luck @Quinn Dombrowski ? I may do a quick test on Monday if not.

@Laryn Good news! I couldn't get it to work at all, so I tried completely uninstalling and re-installing all the Feeds modules and it worked! The first time around, Feeds was something I'd upgraded as part of the D7->Backdrop migration. So it might be worth checking on whether something goes wonky with the upgrade?
Maybe there's an issue with the upgrade code. Not sure if anyone has time, but we could test by comparing the config file produced after an upgrade and one with a fresh install.

Quinn Dombrowski said:

BWPanda Thanks! I gave that a try, and it's still not working. :grimacing: Here's one of the spreadsheet rows:
"46","","Hogarth Press Logo designed By E. McKnight Kauffer ","","Bruce Peel Special Collections, University of Alberta","","16"
and the configuration on Feeds: Screen-Shot-2020-12-04-at-3.30.31-PM.png
but nothing's getting picked up. Is there a step I missed?

@Quinn Dombrowski,
You need the full URI for image fields in the output rows (i.e. hppts://{site-name}/sites/default/files/{file-name} ). There's a drupal module that allows you to export the full URL (https://www.drupal.org/project/image_url_formatter) in views - use rewrite. Someone else here explained to me how to do it exactly and it works great). Once you do that, then the mapping on the input for feeds that you have will work.

@Elisabeth Garbeil Thanks! Even with the full URL it wasn't working before I uninstalled and reinstalled the module, but now it's good. The explode tamper is giving me some trouble with multi-valued fields (subsequent values aren't importing) but that's a problem I can solve down the road. There's few enough muti-valued ones that I can add the further values by hand.

Quinn Dombrowski said:

Laryn Good news! I couldn't get it to work at all, so I tried completely uninstalling and re-installing all the Feeds modules and it worked! The first time around, Feeds was something I'd upgraded as part of the D7->Backdrop migration. So it might be worth checking on whether something goes wonky with the upgrade?

Another reason why I migrate anything more than very simple sites, rather than upgrade :-)

The explode tamper is giving me some trouble with multi-valued fields (subsequent values aren't importing)

@Quinn Dombrowski If you have time, can you make sure there's an issue filed in feeds_tamper's queue?

@Laryn No problem, just posted it! Happy to help test / send reports / etc if I can! This one is going to end up being pretty important for the site, once I hand it over to the clients to import new data.
